title: Can’t access existing collection after upgrading from GitHub versions after alpha95 to a play version
body: ### Checked for duplicates? - [X] This issue is not a duplicate ### What are the steps to reproduce this bug? 1. Upgrade from 2.16alpha95-universal to 2.16alpha97-play-universal 2. Open App ### Expected behaviour The existing collection used in alpha95 is accessible (after one or some dialog messages) ### Actual behaviour The existing collection used in alpha95 is inaccessible as the dialog message of "Inaccessible collection" is shown. https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/230843770-e1c1017c-0fa4-431a-9040-2aeae9da3a66.mp4 ### Debug info ```text AnkiDroid Version = 2.16alpha97 Android Version = 11 Manufacturer = OPPO Model = CPH2013 Hardware = qcom Webview User Agent = Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 11; CPH2013 Build/RKQ1.200903.002; wv) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0 Chrome/110.0.5481.153 Mobile Safari/537.36 ACRA UUID = 88707bf0-b55e-4e77-a11a-552bfe63f79e New schema = false Scheduler = Not found Crash Reports Enabled = true DatabaseV2 Enabled = true ``` ### (Optional) Anything else you want to share? - Reproduced consistently on my Android 11 device above. - Not reproduced if upgrading to alpha97-_full_-universal instead of alpha97-_play_-universal - Not reproduced on my Android 9 device. - On App info screen of alpha97, AnkiDroid icon isn't shown. ### Research - [X] I am reporting a bug specific to AnkiDroid (Android app) - [X] I have checked the [manual](https://ankidroid.org/docs/manual.html) and the [FAQ](https://github.com/ankidroid/Anki-Android/wiki/FAQ) and could not find a solution to my issue - [X] (Optional) I have confirmed the issue is not resolved in the latest alpha release ([instructions](https://docs.ankidroid.org/manual.html#betaTesting))
